name: roby-cc
description: Roby: the smoking cessation bot, confrontational variant

Hi there, I'm Roby!
What's your first name?
We have the same name! Cool!
Thanks, {{ name }}!
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Could you tell me your Quatrics ID?
I think I got it.
Sorry! I have to hear your ID before we can continue. It must be a number consists of 4 digits.
Is this correct {{ params.qualtrics.idStr }}?
Great! Thanks for joining me here today, {{ name }}!
Then please tell me again
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Before we get started, I have a quick question for you. Have you smoked a cigarette in the past week, even a puff?
Thanks.
That's great, {{ name }}. Please keep doing so! :fist:
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?

Before we go further, let me just explain a little about the session today. We're basically going to discuss a few questions to help both of us get a better understanding of your smoking behavior. Does that sound ok to you?
Perfect!
No problem, {{ name }}. :) Just so you know, you can always find me here whenever you want to revisit this.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
First, how old are you?
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
And how long have you been smoking?
Thanks, noted!
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
On average, how many cigarettes do you usually smoke in a day?
Thanks for sharing.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said? Please give me an estimated number.

And how soon after you wake up do you usually have your first cigarette? Please choose between A, B, C, and D. 
 A ) within 5 minutes 
 B ) 6-30 minutes 
 C ) 31-60 minutes 
 D ) after 60 minutes
That's pretty soon. You really have to smoke soon after you wake up.
That's pretty soon. You really have to smoke soon after you wake up.
Ok, not too bad. You don't need a cigarette first thing in the morning.
Ok, not too bad. You don't need a cigarette first thing in the morning.
Sorry, I couldn't catch that. Try again, and make sure you use one of the four letters to indicate your answer!
And is the first smoke in the morning the one that you would most hate to give up?
Seems like you're quite dependent on it, which is not a good sign.
Ok, then maybe you could give up at least this one if not the others.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
I'm curious, which one is your favorite?
Thanks. Next, on a typical day of yours - do you smoke more in the morning?
Got it. It means you have some dependency on it, that could be concerning.
Alright. You can control yourself, at least for a while in the morning.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Which time during the day do you smoke the most, then?
And do you find it difficult to not smoke in places where you're not allowed to? For example, in the cinema or library?
You really need a cigarette when the craving comes to you.
Good. Maybe you could try to have more self control like in this situation.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
I wonder, though, how do you feel when you are in those places where smoking is not allowed?
Ok.
And do you also smoke if you are so ill that you are in bed most of the day?
Ok. Just thought I'd let you know that smoking when ill usually makes your condition worse.
Ok. Seems like you know smoking can make things worse, especially when you're sick.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Tell me more! What do you think about this behavior?
I have one last question. Do you intend to stop smoking in the next 6 months?
You're thinking about stopping smoking in the next 6 months.
So you're not thinking about stopping smoking anytime soon.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
How about within next month?
Yes, that's the right decision you should make.
Ok, so you're just thinking about quitting but not planning to take actions soon. I think you should start doing something though, a step forward is for your own good.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
I'm curious - would you like to try if it was easy?
So you'd consider stopping smoking only if it was easy.
Seems like you're not interested in quitting at all. I hope our conversation today can help you realize that you really need to quit.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Alright, these are all my questions. Thank you for sharing with me, {{ name }}, it's really helping me to get to know your smoking behavior.
I actually had some thought during our conversation, can I share them with you?
Great! I'm curious what you think about other smokers...
Ok. But I was wondering if you think along with me...
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
What percentage of people of your age in the Netherlands do you think smoke? Give me your best shot.
You're pretty spot on, well done!
Not quite right but nice try though.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you tell me again?
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
In 2020, {{ params.norm.actual-comment }} of people of your age in the Netherlands reported that they smoke.
Based on your guess, it seems like fewer people smoke than you thought.
Wait, something went wrong with my calculations. Could you tell me your estimate again?
In psychology, there is the idea that we sometimes think other people are doing the same things as us when most of the time, they're actually not!
So, about {{ params.norm.reverse-comment }} of people of your age DON'T smoke. That's a pretty big number, isn't it?
Here are some popular reasons why people might decide not to smoke.

dialogue_flows.title: goodbye
dialogue_flows.description: Goodbye messages to end the conversation

text: Health is the biggest concern to most people. For example, many people are bothered by shortness of breath and are concerned about increased risk for fatal illness in the long term.

Please select one of the options below by typing the letter of your selection: 
 A ) I learned something! 
 B ) I already knew that.
I couldn't catch that. Try again, and make sure you use one of the two letters to indicate your answer!
Appearance is another popular reason. Yellow teeth and fingers, bad breath, wrinkles caused by smoking are huge disincentives for many people.

Please select one of the options below by typing the letter of your selection: 
 A ) That's something new to me 
 B ) I know this one.
I couldn't catch that. Try again, and make sure you use one of the two letters to indicate your answer!

Personal relationships is also an important factor for many people to stop smoking. Fear of disappointing family members, friends or romantic partners or receiving  pressure from them motivate a lot of smokers to quit.

Please select one of the options below by typing the letter of your selection: 
 A ) Good to know that 
 B ) This has occured to me
I couldn't catch that. Try again, and make sure you use one of the two letters to indicate your answer!
Cost is also a concern to many people. If you smoke one pack of cigarette every day, how much do you have to spend on that in a month? In a year? Well, you do the math.

Please select one of the options below by typing the letter of your selection: 
 A ) I've thought about this 
 B ) Learned something
I couldn't catch that. Try again, and make sure you use one of the two letters to indicate your answer!

dialogue_flows.title: goodbye
dialogue_flows.description: Goodbye messages to end the conversation

text: You told me earlier that {{ params.smoking.quit.summary-comment }}, what do you think now? Is it still the case?
Alright, these are all my questions for this session. I hope our conversation has been useful to you and you will quit soon.
Now you can take a break, and when you're ready for our next session, just type "Hello" and I'll be back!
Please now go back to the questionnaire page and answer a few questions for my creator.
PAY ATTENTION! It is very important for the researcher that you complete this questionnaire completely.

dialogue_flows.title: goodbye
dialogue_flows.description: Goodbye messages to end the conversation

text: It was nice talking to you! Thanks for helping me have a better idea about you and your smoking behavior. In this session now, I will help you find the best way for you to quit.
First, I'm curious. Have you ever stopped smoking before?
Ok, you did stop for a while but unfortunately failed to succeed.
That's a pity.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?

dialogue_flows.title: goodbye
dialogue_flows.description: Goodbye messages to end the conversation

text: How long did your longest quit attempt last?
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Tell me about it, why did you decide to stop?
Right, seems like you know the bad things smoking does to your heath.
Smoking indeed costs a lot.
So you did realize that smoking is not a good thing.

Since you have stopped for {{ params.stoppedBefore.stopDuration.number }} {{ params.stoppedBefore.stopDuration.frequency }} before, maybe you could do it again. I wonder, how did you quit? What methods did you use?
Thank you.
Tell me one positive feeling you had during those days.
{{ params.stoppedBefore.feelings.posOne-comment }} Right, living without cigarettes is not that bad. I think you should quit again.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Looking back from now, what else were you feeling?
It was the right thing for you to do.
There are so many good things you can think of - better health, fresher breath, saving more money...
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Why not try it again?
What I'm hearing so far is that you've quit before, but failed to succeed. You did see some good things during those days, but they didn't stop you from going back to smoking again.
What I'm hearing so far is that you've quit before, but failed to succeed. You did see some good things during those days, but they didn't stop you from going back to smoking again.
What I'm hearing so far is that you've quit before, but unfortunately failed to succeed. You only felt suffering but didn't see the benefits quitting brings you.
You don't see the immediate consequences of smoking, but they influence your health slowly. Since you've quit before, do you think you can do it again?
I don't see why you can't, and you definitely should - you should learn from the past.
I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase what you just said?
Ok, what would you say you learned from your last quit attempt?
Tell me, if you see it as a learning experience, what would you say you learned from your last quit attempt?
Ok, that's something you should improve.
There are many methods that help people quit. You could try nicotine replacement, counselling, medication is also possible. Some people also find going cold turkey helpful.
You just need to make your decision to quit, make a plan, and stick to it.
Now let's talk about the plan. What would be your first step to quit?
Seems like you're not ready to have a quit plan. But that's really important for you to do.

These are what smokers find useful when they quit. Choose what you'd like to try: 
 A ) Go cold turkey 
 B ) Nicotine patch/gum 
 C ) Counseling 
 D ) Medication from doctors
I couldn't catch that. Try again, and make sure you use one of the two letters to indicate your answer!

dialogue_flows.title: goodbye
dialogue_flows.description: Goodbye messages to end the conversation

text: Why didn't you?
You know, every cigarette counts. Smoking just one cigarette a day raises 40%-50% risk of heart issues and stroke.
In 2020, more than 1/3 smokers made a serious quit attempt. I don't see why you can't.
You might think smoking helps relieve stress, but it's actually causing stress to your body - blood pressure and heart rate :up:, oxygen in your body :down:
One-a-day won't keep the doctor away.
You just need to make up your mind.
Try healthier ways to deal with stress.

Pick one activities below that you'd like to do: 
 A ) do some physical activities, 
 B ) talk to a friend 
 C ) have some fun (gardening, cooking, movie... something you enjoy doing), 
 D ) ask for help.
I couldn't catch that. Try again, and make sure you use one of the two letters to indicate your answer!
Also, maybe you didn't see it, but our first assessment session shows that you have a {{ params.nicotineDependency-comment }} level of nicotine dependence, and that's not a good sign.

What do you think? 
Please select: 
 A ) I didn't know that 
 B ) Good to know 
 C ) I don't think it's that serious
Nicotine dependent smokers are at more risk of lung and heart issues. Maybe you didn't realize this and didn't quit before, but now it's the time.
I couldn't catch that. Try again, and make sure you use one of the two letters to indicate your answer!
Imagine if you decided to quit, how confident are you that you could quit? On a scale from 0-10, where 0 is not at all confident and 10 is extremely confident, where would you say you are?
Seems like you're not very confident in quitting.
Seems like you're not 100% confident in yourself after all.
Tell me about it!
I'm sorry I didn't get that. Try again? Give me a number!
I'm sorry but you need to give me a number between 1 and 10! Try again?
I'm sorry but you need to give me a number between 1 and 10! Try again?

There are many effective approaches that are popular with quitters. Choose one of the below that you'd like to try.: 
 A ) Go cold turkey

 E ) None of them. I'll go my own way.
Ok, tell me about it
I couldn't catch that. Try again, and make sure you use one of the two letters to indicate your answer!
What's your strategy?
That's something that works for you.
